workflow.name: Find top-performing Instagram Reels & save insights to Notion with Gemini & Apify
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This template helps you discover trending Instagram Reels from competitors or any public profiles you choose. 

### ðŸ“º How It Works 

The workflow automatically monitors selected Instagram accounts using Apify, pulls recent Reels, and analyzes their performance.  

It calculates engagement levels, detects early â€œhotâ€ content, translates text if needed, and organizes all results into a structured Notion database â€” ready for review and production.

I've recorded a video walkthrough to show you how the system works in detail.
ðŸ‘‰ [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rdfRNHpHX8o](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rdfRNHpHX8o)

@[youtube](rdfRNHpHX8o)

---

### ðŸ“„ Download Notion Database Structure  
You can download the Notion table structure (with all required columns and formats) here:  
ðŸ‘‰ [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FVaS_-ztp6PDAJbETUb1dkg8IqE4qHqp/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FVaS_-ztp6PDAJbETUb1dkg8IqE4qHqp/view?usp=sharing)

---

### ðŸ‘¤ **Whoâ€™s it for**

This workflow is for marketers, content creators, social media managers, and automation enthusiasts who want to stay ahead of Instagram Reels trends.  
Whether you're building a content pipeline or studying competitors, this tool saves hours of manual tracking.

---

### ðŸ”§ **How to set up**

1. Create the required databases in Notion (structure file provided).  
2. Import the `.json` workflow into your n8n instance.  
3. Set up credentials for Notion, Apify, and Gemini API.  
4. Link those credentials in the workflow.  
5. Adjust the `Variables` node with your test account list and settings.  
6. Run a test with 3â€“5 profiles and validate the output.  
7. Once working, update `Variables` with your full config.

---

### ðŸ“‹ **Requirements**

- An n8n instance (self-hosted or cloud)  
- A Notion account (separate workspace recommended)  
- Apify account (usage-based pricing for Instagram scraping)  
- Gemini API key for AI processing (usage-based pricing)

---

### ðŸ§© **How to customize the workflow**

The system is fully modular. You can:
- In the `Set Prompt` node, you can define your own rules for detecting content categories and video types.
- Change video filters (e.g., what counts as â€œhotâ€ or â€œearly hotâ€) 
- Modify Notion fields or adapt to your own database structure  
- Add more parsing logic to `Variables`  
- Switch translation language 
- Integrate with your content production flow

Each part of the workflow is clearly labeled and editable â€” feel free to adapt it to your goals.

assignments.name: AnalyzePrompt
assignments.value:
=Perform the following tasks based on the video/audio content:

1. Create a full transcription of the audio â€” convert speech to text exactly as spoken, without interpretation or summarization, so it can be easily read or re-voiced later.

2. Identify a strong hook from the first few seconds of the content that can grab attention.

3. Determine the category of the content using the following rules:
- Business: if the video shares business advice
- Marketing: if the video shares marketing advice
- Cooking: if the video shares cooking advice
- Interview: if the video is an interview with a guest
- Unknown: if the category cannot be determined

4. Identify the video format using the following options:
- Head: if it's a talking-head video
- Animation: if it's animated or presented with drawings
- Unknown: if the format is unclear

5. Translate the full transcription and the hook into {{ $('Variables').first().json.translationLang }}.

Return the result in **pure JSON format** with the following fields:  
`transcription`, `hook`, `category`, `format`, `translation`, `translation_hook`.

**Do not include any commentary or explanations. Only return the JSON.**

parameters.content:
### ðŸ“º How It Works â€“ Watch the Video  
I've recorded a video walkthrough to show you how the system works in detail.
ðŸ‘‰ [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rdfRNHpHX8o](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rdfRNHpHX8o)


### ðŸ“„ Download Notion Database Structure  
You can download the Notion table structure (with all required columns and formats) here:  
ðŸ‘‰ [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FVaS_-ztp6PDAJbETUb1dkg8IqE4qHqp/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FVaS_-ztp6PDAJbETUb1dkg8IqE4qHqp/view?usp=sharing)

### â˜• Support the Project  
If you'd like to support my work, there's a version with tips available here:
ðŸ‘‰ [Coffee + Sandwich Version](https://gr.egrnkvch.com/l/InstagramReelsTrendWatcher)

## âš™ï¸ How to Install the Template

1. **Create the databases in Notion.**  
   Make sure to use the exact column names and formats as shown in the provided structure.

2. **Import the workflow template into n8n.**

3. **Add your Credentials:**
   - **Notion**: Standard Notion integration  
   - **Apify**: Create and connect your Apify API key

4. **Gemini API is used via HTTP Request node.**  
   Use the following settings:  
   - `Authentication`: **Predefined Credential Type**  
   - `Credential Type`: **Google Gemini (PaLM) API**  
   - `Host`: `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com`  
   - API key: your personal Gemini API key

5. **Assign these credentials** in the corresponding nodes inside the workflow.

6. **Configure the Variables node** to set parsing parameters.  
   Test the process with 3â€“5 accounts, each with 3â€“5 Reels.  
   Once everything works, update the Variables with your full settings.
This is the prompt used to process video content and classify its category and type. Customize it based on your logic.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
